condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, WASH sector stakeholders are equipped with an enabling environment for better planning, budgeting, implementing and monitoring of interventions.

description.narrative: BCO advocated for leveraging resources by channelling flexible development funds towards emergency responses to respond to the growing humanitarian needs further aggravated by COVID emergence in the country. As the lead of the Technical and Financial Partner (PTF) group, the WASH section regularized the coordination meetings which helped ensure smooth sectoral planning and monitoring. To strengthen evidence-based planning and service delivery in the WASH sector, the BCO also completed a KAP study on WASH. The results will be used for WSP piloting in the second half of the year. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Financial resources mobilized through innovative financing mechanisms as a direct result of UNICEF support
Number of people accessing the agreed quantity of water for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene
A multisectoral budget is available at national level for financing WASH in schools initiatives (construction and management)
A code of conduct for drilling is developed and published
